title: Kelvin Boateng
text:
I am a graduate student in the Master of Geomatics for Environmental Management (MGEM) program, Faculty of Forestry and Environmental Stewardship, at the University of British Columbia. My focus is on the use of geomatics and spatial data to support environmental analysis and decision-making.
I have developed practical skills in GIS, remote sensing, and spatial analysis with coding (R-studio, Python, Google Earth Engine) through coursework that emphasized real-world applications. Each course challenged me to apply technical methods to environmental and resource management problems, building both my analytical capabilities and understanding of how these tools support decision-making in the field.
This e-portfolio brings together the coursework, projects, and reflections from my time in the MGEM program. It showcases the technical skills and analytical methods I’ve developed, as well as my growth as a professional in this field. I’ve compiled this portfolio to demonstrate my capabilities and support my career goals in surveying, geomatics and environmental management.

Education

Technical Skills

• Surveying Tools: AutoCAD Civil 3D, Topcon Tools, Magnet Tools, MapInfo

Work Experience
Geomatic Engineer, Mac Partners Mining and Construction – Konongo, Ghana Oct 2024 – July 2025
• Accurately set out tower cranes, CIL tanks, and ball mills using Stonex Total Station and Hi-Target equipment, ensuring precise alignment with the approved site layout.
• Established anchor bolt positions for structural components, enabling secure installation of bolts and nuts for critical equipment.
• Verified excavation levels with a Bosch dumpy level to determine cut-and-fill requirements, optimizing earthwork planning and material usage.
• Re-ordinated control pillars using Hi-Target GPS to maintain spatial accuracy and integrity of site control points
Assistant Surveyor, Point Engineering, Accra Aug 2024 – Oct 2024
• Conducted comprehensive topographic and construction surveys using Trimble, Sokkia, and CHCNAV GPS systems to produce accurate topography maps and as-built documentation.
• Precisely marked reinforcement layouts, column positions, and base points to ensure correct structural alignment during construction.
• Successfully surveyed and profiled a 14 km road corridor using CHCNAV GPS, providing essential data for road design and engineering planning.
Geomatic Engineer Sedzie Survey Engineering, Accra May 2024 – Aug 2024
• Performed detailed road profiling at designated chainages to generate accurate sectional road designs and construction data.
• Executed land demarcation using E-Survey software and CHCNAV GPS to delineate property parcels and link road alignments with precision.
• Developed high-quality topographical maps from survey data collected on-site, supporting design and planning processes.
• Survey Assistant (NationalServicePersonnel) AM Surveys Ltd, Haatso–Accra Oct 2022 – Sep 2023
• Processed drone imagery using Agisoft Metashape to generate high-resolution orthophotos for accurate site representation.
• Produced detailed topographic maps in AutoCAD Civil 3D to support design and construction planning.
• Conducted precise parcel demarcation using E-Survey GPS, ensuring accurate land boundary delineation.


Leadership/Volunteering Experience
Training Coordinator, UMaT YouthMappers Jan 2021 – Oct 2022
• Conducted GIS training sessions and led OpenStreetMap mapping campaigns to enhance community mapping skills and spatial data accuracy.
• Trained team members on creating maps using GIS software, including QGIS and ArcMap, improving their technical proficiency in geospatial analysis.
• Organized and facilitated drone training sessions for mappers, covering the complete workflow of drone data acquisition and processing.
• Mapped areas around Tema to support COVID-19 PPE distribution efforts, improving location data for emergency response.
• Contributed to streetlight and hydrant mapping projects through mobile and online OSM platforms, enhancing community infrastructure data.
Vice President, Geomatic Engineering Student Association Jan 2021 – Nov 2021
• Trained colleague students in using geospatial tools during tutorials organized by the department.
• Obtained funds to run our administration together with the other executives.
• Led the department in the registration of student members of the Ghana Institution of Surveyors.
